data.title: Lifeline Ventures
data.text:
Companies

No case is too early for us. We often help companies with their first crucial steps and continue supporting them through their growth. We look for teams that have the potential to become category leaders in fields such as climate tech, health, hardware, marketplaces, and software but we acknowledge that the most interesting opportunities can come from anywhere.

We only invest in companies where we believe we can truly help. We want to be the first ones the entrepreneur reaches out to in times of trouble and joy.

Filter Companies

Aiven

Aiven provides fully managed cloud database and messaging services hosted in the cloud of the customer’s choice, including Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure. Its mission is to allow developers to focus on building awesome applications without worrying about data infrastructure management.

CEO: Oskari Saarenmaa

Founders: Oskari Saarenmaa, Heikki Nousiainen, Mika Eloranta, Hannu Valtonen

Akkurate

Akkurate’s team has a broad experience in battery production chain, battery development and lifecycle management. Services include technology consulting, testing and analysis, specification optimization, charging system design, manufacturing assessments and for example complete technical supplier evaluation.

The first company in the world that can completely control power ultrasound to clean fouling from different type of equipment without stopping production. The disruptive technology also minimizes maintenance time, energy consumption and use of hazardous chemicals in these cleaning processes.

AREX’s product is an automated receivables exchange platform where SME invoices are converted into a tradable asset class called Exchange Traded Receivables (ETRs). ETRs are then sold on an open market where a single ETR can be purchased by one or multiple investors using automated trading bots.

Carbo Culture carbonizes biomass waste into biocarbon products for soil and environmental applications. By rapidly converting carbon to a solid and stable form, the company prevents it from escaping back into the atmosphere for over 100 years. The products are frequently used across industries, in agriculture and research.

Clouder, founded in 2023, is on a mission to enable sustainable next generation real estate by changing how building tech connectivity is done. Clouder is building virtual cabling technology for commercial real estate to reduce cables, waste, spending, and emissions both in construction and throughout lifecycle renovations.

Cooler Future is a fintech startup developing transparent and effective impact investment solutions for the climate-conscious generation. The company’s mission is to create positive climate impact by investing in assets from companies that are actively reducing their carbon footprint. With Cooler Future’s intuitive, easy-to-use mobile app, anyone can track the CO2e impact of each euro invested, while generating financial returns at the same time.

CurifyLabs

Through modernizing the drug compounding process in pharmacies, CurifyLabs enables sustainable, on-demand manufacture of medicines, customized to provide safe and effective treatment for all patients. CurifyLabs is committed to automating and streamlining the drug compounding process enabling personalization of drug treatments to better fit the need of each specific patient. Our goal is to maximize the personalization potential of drug treatments for better patient outcomes with our pharmaceutical 3D printing concept. The technology is based on over 10 years of extensive academic research conducted by Professor Niklas Sandler Topelius and his research group. Today CurifyLabs serves pharmacies on several European markets with a talented team of pharmaceutical formulation developers, software engineers and quality control experts.

Flowrite is an AI-powered writing tool that lets you convert your thoughts into full-length emails, messages, posts, and other written content on the web. In a nutshell, Huuva operates technology enabled kitchens in the most optimal locations for delivery food around cities. Restaurants can focus on the cooking, while Huuva takes care of everything else. This helps restaurants minimize costs and maximize returns from delivery food, while serving delicious dishes to eaters every single time.

In Parallel adds clarity and adaptability to your operating model. Our technology closes the gaps between strategy and execution, integrating internal and external factors to provide real-time insights that make strategies more relevant, resilient, and adaptable.

Origin by Ocean

Origin by Ocean is a biorefining company making sustainable ingredients for the chemicals industry from invasive and farmed seaweeds. Our patented refinery process transforms algae into a variety of functional chemicals while reducing the excess nutrients in our oceans. They can be used as healthy, economical and oil-free ingredients for everyday consumer goods ranging from food and cosmetics to textiles and novel packaging materials. Our biorefinery is unique in utilising its entire feedstock to produce numerous molecule-level ingredients and useful biomass from just one process. Highly scalable and able to integrate with existing industry, it will catalyse a new era of regenerative value chains that actively benefit the ecosystems so crucial for our flourishing.

ZenRobotics

ZenRobotics, founded in 2007, is a global leader in smart robotic recycling and the first company to apply AI-based sorting robots to a complex waste-sorting environment. ZenRobotics’ robots, powered by the company’s very own AI software, make recycling more efficient, accurate and profitable.

CEO: Wolfgang Schiller

Founders: Harri Valpola, Jufo Peltomaa, Timo Taalas, Tuomas Lukka
